## Steps to reproduce

Change system locale to non-English such as Chinese, then run `Start-PSBuild`. It will fail at around line 847 of `src\Microsoft.PowerShell.PackageManagement\Cmdlets\AsyncCmdlet.cs` which it contains some non-ASCII characters when logging. Changing system locale to English will work.
## Expected behavior

It should build on systems with non-English system locale.
## Actual behavior

Failed to build.
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

comments.author: wangzq
comments.body: I believe it is because the file is not saved as UTF-8 so right now the left & right pointing double angle quotation mark are in their ASCII value which is `0xAB` and `0xBB`; when read on a system with Chinese as default system locale, the `0xBB` and ending `"` will be treated as a DBCS character thus causing compiler to fail. If we save the file as UTF-8 they will become `0xC2AB` and `0xC2BB`, which works correctly on any system locales.

title: Cannot build on Windows with non-English system locale: "newline in constant" when building AsyncCmdlet.cs
